website_summaries.verdict: It isn't cheap compared to standard printers, but the Canon Pixma iP100 has the highest resolution available in the mobile printer market and prints at an impressive speed to boot. If you simply must have a printer with you at all times, the iP100 should be the do-it-all at your side.
pros: High-resolution ink nozzles produce excellent prints
significant speed improvements over previous model
cons: No Wi-Fi or carrying case options
high price tag relative to those of desktop printers

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the Canon Pixma iP100 Printer for about the last 10 years, or whenever it first came out. I work in different law offices every day and needed a "portable office". The iP100 is reliable, prints quickly and is a hard worker. I print approximately 500 sheets of paper each week with the iP100 and it just keeps on going. After about 2 years of very heavy duty use, the printer starts to not feed the paper through as well or gets paper jams, so I know I need to retire it and get a new one. For the price, this is a great printer!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Traveling Lawyers
customer_reviews.text: I am a criminal defense lawyer practicing in most of Northern California's county courts. The closest is a 2 hour drive, and morning hearings require me to stay at a motel. In other words, I can't be racing back to the office to get that last minute motion done, or to write that important letter. I take my Mac Air everywhere, of course, and I use this wonderful little printer in the motel, even in the (parked) car sometimes to get the paperwork printed which is essential to the day. It has never failed me. I suggest travelers who have to generate print, consider this. And, don't forget to get a converter for 12v operation in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: ED Denson

customer_reviews.title: Don't forget the USB!
customer_reviews.text: Hey there little guy! This printer is adorable, fast, and takes up no space in my place! The photo quality is through the roof. But remember to buy a usb cord (I purchased mine on Amazon for like 5 bucks), for whatever reason it doesn't come with one. I thought it was a mistake and returned the first one of these I purchased. All in all though, this is sooooo fast and easy to use. AND you can charge it through a car charger? What? AND it holds a charge and is portable. Ok... this is the best printer I've ever had. Just saying. Thanks Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Marie SherilTop Contributor: Sailor Moon

customer_reviews.title: Great size, slow printing, and buggy software
customer_reviews.text: I drive around a lot and have been searching for a good printer to set up in my pickup and make invoices for my customers on the fly. The size is great and the weight is awesome. However, it burns through ink very quickly and I have a lot of trouble finding ink for this printer in stores. It can get confused and take forever to print as well. This is the second, and last, printer by Canon I have owned. The software seems very buggy as well. The printer doesn't seem to like shifting between legal and letter size paper. I think my next one will be Epsons mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Burkle

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality is decent but def not the best. You are paying triple the price for portability ...
customer_reviews.text: Thr Printer doesnt have a wifi feature and takes forever to start up. Every time you want to print, you have to turn on the printer and it takes about 2-3 minutes to boot up and print Its very portable and compact but very expensive for what your getting. Picture quality is decent but def not the best. You are paying triple the price for portability of the printer.
customer_reviews.author: j24

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these printers 1 1/2 years ago and it was doing so good. A great size to carry and printed great. It stopped printing all of a sudden and since I had ordered several ink cart. I decided to order another. The new one I ordered didn't print the first time out of the box. I think you have a problem that needs fixing. This is not a cheap printer and it should last longer than 1 1/2 years with minimum use. I was very disappointed. When I returned the one that was broke, I had to pay for the return. Was that fare. I don't think so .
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: Great Portable Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the printer to use a week long seminar in Africa. I put it in a computer case to carry it in my carryon luggage. I brought two extra black cartridges and on spare color cartridge. I was very impressed with the overall performance. I printed almost a ream of black and white print for schedules, invoices, forms and instructions. Then I printed 100 4x6 conference photos. The color photos were great. The B&W print was also great. This is a solid and relatively fast portable printer. I plan to carry it whenever I travel for work.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyG

customer_reviews.title: An old model of printer according to Canon Technical Support
customer_reviews.text: So far, I have been unable to use this printer since the USB cable (according to Canon Tech Support) is defective and I have contacted that seller for approval for return/replacement. I purchased this mobile photo printer because it was the only small and compact printer available on the Amazon website. I was told by the Canon Tech Support representative I was speaking with that he could not order or send me one of Canon's USB cords for this printer because the printer itself is a very old model -- 2007 or 2009 I believe he told me. A very unpleasing thing to hear, eh?
customer_reviews.author: Lynne A. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Very effective for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This is a perfect printer if you travel frequently and need high quality print output on the road. This is a great example of minimalist engineering and it fits in a small laptop case that I had on hand. I was so impressed that I purchased the grossly overpriced Bluetooth connector, and it works perfectly. Cons:The software works but is not terribly user friendly. The paper feed is tricky and seems more an art than a science when loading. Overall a great investment for the road warrior!
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Great for portability & printing... Meh for cost to run.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable printer. We have 10 of them for the business. They're pretty fast but don't expect to print 40 pages 'fast.' For small jobs, this is great. For bigger jobs, not a great option. Also - cartridges don't last long and, as with all printers these days, the cartridges are expensive. My home HP all-in-one seems to get a lot more bang for the buck cartridge-wise. But when you look at the actual print quality & portability, this is a nifty little printer and good for small print jobs on the road...
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Gee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Portable Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Recently, when my original portable printer, a 17 year old Canon BJC-70, began to have performance issues, I embarked on a search to find a suitable replacement. After extensive online research, this Canon PIXMA iP 100 was the winner. Good luck finding another printer with this print quality for both photos and text, or this amount of versatility and features including portability (battery pack and bluetooth adapter are available options), and all for a price under $175, which is less than I paid for it's predecessor in 1995. Unless you require laser output, this is the best value in printers today. Highest recommendation!
customer_reviews.author: Maverick 86

customer_reviews.title: Smallest, and best, printer I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something that wouldn't take up much space - that was my main reason for choosing this. What I got was a printer that prints FANTASTIC photos far beyond what I expected or thought was possible. Truly. Far better than when I order from Shutterfly, etc., I'd sooner print my own photos on this since they look a lot nicer than ordering prints online. I use Canon semi-gloss photo paper and get great results. Mine didn't have bluetooth but I bet that's a nice feature. This is one of those purchases that surprised me a ton with how awesome it was because I expected it to be just okay. It's excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Lifehack G

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer; troublesome installation process.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you don't make the same mistake I did and use the CD-ROM included in the box. This printer came out in 2006! I didn't realize this at the time of installing the CD. The install hung and I spent an hour total before realizing what was wrong, uninstalling everything and starting over. When I started over, however, I did so with the use of the drivers from Canon's website. I highly recommend that you do the same. That time the install took about 10 minutes and went smoothly. So, bottom line, great printer but make sure you download the latest software from Canon's site and DO NOT use the included CD-ROM.
customer_reviews.author: TINETQL

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: After less than 200 pages had to replace the printhead ($71.oo). Very unreliable. And swallows ink. The ink cartridges are very small for photo printing. They won't print more than 60 pages in standard quality each. (Never the 290 pages promised) That's the reason why they sale cartridges for this printer by bulk (12 B + 12 Color) With a constant use you'll be changing cartridges a number of times per day. However, it is mobile, wireless and gorgeous. I suppose a proper working Pixma IP100 printer should be great for specific tasks. UPDATE. The replacement printhead failed after 1 week of use.
customer_reviews.author: MD PARRA

customer_reviews.title: Small, quality printer but with a strange problem
customer_reviews.text: Slightly louder than the iP90 and I found the printer to be quite smelly, the ink smell seeps out as soon as you open the tray and it's quite a strong smell.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: ... are having problems to print the pictures in a good quality print
customer_reviews.text: The printer is not even a year old and we are having problems to print the pictures in a good quality print. Even though we downloaded the drivers to clean the printer heads, deep clean and align them, we still are having issues that when it prints it does not print a good quality and makes the black parts appear weird. We have the original Canon ink cartridges in there and we don't know what to do anymore with it and have to probably pay to repair if it is possible to repair.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: just bought still new
customer_reviews.text: while setting it up, which was easy, i was surprised to find out that the printer USB port to the computer was not included so it was another trip to the store just to buy one. would be nice if they had a more of a selection of cases. i read the review on the only case they offer with this printer and the person stated the case was too small and not room to store the cord with the printer. i haven't had a chance to really use it yet. so hopefully soon i can come back in and do another preview.
customer_reviews.author: msthamara

customer_reviews.title: Best Small Printer on the Market
customer_reviews.text: I've been a fan of Canon Pixma series since they came out. The Canon iP100 is amazing. It is light, mobile,fast, and produces the best color for a small portable printer than any other printer available. It also holds more paper than previous models. If there is a downside it is expensive compared to other printers. However, one thing Canon does that betters other printers is produce a quality product. Canon reminds me of Apple like products that doesn't compromise on quality. It is built solid, has a beauty to it and works easily. You can't go wrong on this printer and you'll be pleased at it's level of productivity.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Horn

customer_reviews.title: Compact and very good quality
customer_reviews.text: We've had this little printer for about four years. Love it! It has never given us a lick of trouble. Wish I had all the money back that we've spent over the years on fancy-schmancy multiple feature printers when this little Canon does exactly what we want ... PRINT.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia K.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: This product wasn't right for me - hence 4 stars! But the customer service was spot on. They refunded me every dollar when I returned. I was late to use the product and when I went to return it I realised I only had a day left before they would no longer accept returns (you must return within two months). I just wanted something smaller for my business needs. It would be great if they put up a "to scale" picture so you can see the sizing. It is definitely small but I need something 1/2 this size. Buy it! Its great. Service is brilliant
customer_reviews.author: Miss Lee Lee

customer_reviews.title: tahoe
customer_reviews.text: After receiving and installing the lithium battery to the canon printer the unit is now truly portable. No wires to connect to the cigarette plug. Where wifi is available or a hotspot I can print any where. The printer was easy to set up and install the software. The blue tooth which was a little extra money but well worth the price was installed. with not much difficulty. The size is very compact. The printing speed suits my needs. Its not the quickest but it is also not a office setting when used by me. A great printer for someone who needs portability and a small size.. A little slow so I give it four stars.
customer_reviews.author: tahoe

customer_reviews.title: O U T S T A N D I N G !
customer_reviews.text: The printer arrived this morning, right on (Prime) schedule. It came with the battery I ordered, so I let it charge while I got everything else ready. It took about four hours for the battery to be fully charged. Setup was completely painless. I installed it, with the software, on my Eeee PC, running XP. I aligned the Print Head. Then I took the SD Card out of my Canon Rebel T4i, and made the first print. The result: excellent, outstanding, divine! Need I say more?
customer_reviews.author: Bill McLean

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer so far
customer_reviews.text: I needed something like this for reports out in the field, this is perfect. I wound up using a Cirago BTA3210 v2.1 Bluetooth adapter and it pairs up perfectly - $16 here at amazon ($45 for the canon adapter).  Amazon also sells a dedicated case for this, 'Surf to Summit' is the manufacturer. Neat little case but I opted for a Targus case that can fit all of the extras I need - paper, extra ink, power cords, etc.
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

customer_reviews.title: Five stars, I can't find anything I don't like........yet
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my truck, I charge it at home every two weeks so I do not have to carry the power supply around with me. I did purchase the battery and Bluetooth unit for it, and use it with a 2012 power book. I have had no problems with it, and rides on the rear floorboard. I do not print pictures on with it, just business related paperwork, so I cannot attest to its ultimate print quality. It performs flawlessly for what I use it for, it replaced my HP portable that I used for years.
customer_reviews.author: RJS

customer_reviews.title: Travel and print on the go with BT
customer_reviews.text: It's small, the quality is fine on plain paper or photo paper, the tools and software it comes with are usefull. Borderless printing and with an Optional BT adapter, you can loose a cable, a step further; add a battery adapter and get rid of the power cable, until it needs charged again. It fits in my laptop bag, along with my Alienware 17" beast of a laptop. You'll pay more for it than most inkjet printers, but the size and convienience make up for it. Get LD ink cartridges from [...] and save on ink as well.
customer_reviews.author: SSG M

customer_reviews.title: Big results in a small package
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer! Three years later it is as good to me now and the first day I received it. It really prints great pictures, but word to the wise, buy canon ink otherwise it's a waste of time and photo paper. I have a canon picture printer and this is does just as good and I printed 45 4x6 prints. Very happy and you will be too
customer_reviews.author: L J

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty cool--very small and compact and light weight but has ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty cool--very small and compact and light weight but has great printing quality. This may not be the right printer as a heavy-duty workhorse, but it's been great for me to keep tucked away and to pull out when I need a document hard copy or to print an image, etc. Easy to use and clean design.
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: cannon PIXMA iP100 Mobile Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: This little printer has worked well for me. I'm a solo practitioner in the law and I often have to print legal documents at a bedside in a hospital, nursing home or home. I've never had any technical problems with it. Because it is small, I've inadvertently brushed it off the table several times when walking by (on a small table where the end sticks out). The last time I did so it finally went kaput. It did not deter me from buying a new one. It's likely the only printer i'll ever buy (I plan on buying one more--one for office and one for traveling).
customer_reviews.author: slingersue

customer_reviews.title: Very good portable printer
customer_reviews.text: Much improved over the i90 series. Much faster than predecessor. Bluetooth installed. Has good color action (though it can take a while for printer to ready itself when color is used in any way). Good software notifications (for the Mac, at least). Seems sturdy. Has separate setting for envelope-thick paper. More reliable with such heavier stock than predecessor. All such printers, however, use expensive ink (if you use Canon's), and high-usage results in very costly per-page expenses.
customer_reviews.author: Noho48

customer_reviews.title: This is otherwise a fine little portable printer but the fact that it is ...
customer_reviews.text: This is otherwise a fine little portable printer but the fact that it is not wireless is a very big drawback for me. I even bought the Canon Bluetooth dongle to try to get it to work with my iPad and iPhone but no luck. After hours of searching on line for help I finally went to my local Apple store and met with the "genius" techs but even they said it was hopeless. I guess it needs a cable period. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gray

customer_reviews.title: I've carried this printer on 5 continents in my suitcase ...
customer_reviews.text: I've carried this printer on 5 continents in my suitcase on my travels. It is a simple machine, only doing printing; but that is all I need. Very reliable. I've actually carried a simple home printer in the past and they tend to leak the ink with the jostling of my baggage. The secret of this travel printer is that it is light, compact, AND the carriage seals the ends of the ink cartridges so that they do not leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Suits our needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: We needed a small portable printer for our RV after we lost our home in the Bastrop, TX fires. I'd used one like this years ago and liked it, so I figured I'd try the new model. We are not disappointed. Its fast and easy. Because it is so small, it stores away nicely. We set it up with a Bluetooth card (Medialink version 3.0+HS Class 2). MacBook Pro laptops. Nice printing options for color or grayscale only, and quality. A bit pricey, but suits our needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: jeffw9

customer_reviews.title: The best portable printer out there
customer_reviews.text: They have not changed this model in over five years because it's that good. This is my second. My first died after four years of hard traveling. I splurged and got the Bluetooth and Battery and it really is cordless now. If someone asks me what to buy for a portable printer, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Cranky Old Man

customer_reviews.title: Great portable all round printer!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know how good a small printer could be, but when I tried the PIXMA iP100, I was amazed. Not only did this print excellent B/W, color was great. Photos printed on the printer looked as good as photos printed on my $4,000 photo printer. And it portable!
customer_reviews.author: Jas

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: My new Canon PIXMA iP100 mobile printer works great using a Surface Pro computer running Windows 8. Contrary to comments on the internet(probably old), it works fine with Windows 8 and I only had to load the CD that came with the printer and did not have to go looking for drivers. The bluetooth feature works perfectly using the Canon BU-30 blue tooth adapter which I purchased separately and installed in the printer. Print quality is excellent and the small size of the printer is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Clem Wehner

customer_reviews.title: Photos look nice when the printer is new
customer_reviews.text: Photos look nice when the printer is new. Ink dries out promptly causing printer head issues. Have had to replace it twice!! Do not recommend ANY canon products due to poor customer support. Had to deal with them twice and they were of no help, they brush you off and expect you to pay more to get their stuff fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Aych K

customer_reviews.title: Great for trade shows
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer for taking on the road. It fits great in a double laptop bag next to a laptop. It prints fast and crisp. The only thing I would like is for them to make a black and white only version, we have no need for color. The ink is a little expensive but it seems to last us a long time. We always take spare cartridges but never need them.
customer_reviews.author: Tbonge

customer_reviews.title: Best Travel Printer Ever....Been Using for Years Now and do not want to go to anything else
customer_reviews.text: Use this printer when I am out of my office
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L. Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Super portable printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer about 2 years ago and it's still working great. I take it with me and it prints great. I haven't printed any photos yet. I love that you can print on something as small as a business card. I printed lots and lots of 3x5 recipe cards. Although I only use this printer for travel, I have yet to change the ink cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Weez

customer_reviews.title: Used it for 60 pages and threw it away - piece of GARBAGE!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of F&*(%&G garbage. Got this for a cruiseship contract.... used it for 60 pages before it broke. Went to use the return policy and it was outside the window for returning. Feeling totally ripped off by a complete piece of garbage. This isn't worth spending anything on. Major disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Womach

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer!!! Used mainly for printing on paper and note cards. It's fast, reliable and quality is better than my large desktop printer. Great for travel and is also a "go to" at home when quality is needed. Have traveled quite a bit with it in suitcase, wrapped in a towel, and never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: @Pitman_knives

customer_reviews.title: Great for portability
customer_reviews.text: Love having the portability of this little printer. It is light weight and compact. I can carry it to workshops or when traveling on vacation. With blue tooth added I can print from anywhere in the house. Wish it was compatible with my iPad, though because as an artist I use my iPad to take and alter photos for mixed media and quilting on cotton. The portability of this little printer is exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Fiberartist47

customer_reviews.title: A compact portable printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact printer. We take it on the boat and motorhome. The complaint is feeding the first piece of paper can be tricky. Other than that a great printer.
customer_reviews.author: Nordski

customer_reviews.title: Measurements betrayed me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for the width measurement. I had to fit it into a specific space. Unfortunately, Canon has decided to put all plugs on the side. So the printer is going to be many more inches wide than suggested.
customer_reviews.author: P. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and use!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in less than a week. Setup was easy and I was printing with a cord (NOT INCLUDED) within about 20 minutes. Did I mention the cord is not included! Remember to get one. Prints clear and clean sheets. I will be using it for mostly black and white documents. Printer is fast and easy. I would recommend it for someone who wants to print from anywhere. I bought the bluetooth and battery as well. Both are great.
customer_reviews.author: tdy357w1

customer_reviews.title: Great little portable printer
customer_reviews.text: Worked well while I had it. Bought it for use on the road, but since it was expensed to my employers, I had to surrender it when I retired in Nov 2013. Had some concern about the flimsy plastic cover pieces, but never managed to break any. Was in and out of my briefcase several times a day for almost 18 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Device
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to be on the road with me, it is great. I can provide clean, original documents without waiting in line at a kinks or a in the hotel lobby. Love the speed of the printer and the size is unbelievable. Thank you Cannon for rescuing the Small Business Traveler.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia H.

customer_reviews.title: Great little color/black and white printer
customer_reviews.text: Great little printer. Bought it for my daughter for college and she uses it every day .We had it for a little over two years now . Prints great black and white and the color photos are great. Don't want to carry around a large printer then this Canon is for you. It sits right on her desk in the dorm don't require much space . Would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: TDE

customer_reviews.title: Overall good mobile printer
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Print quality is excellent - Both weight and size are acceptable even with the battery - Ink lasts longer than I expected Cons: - Bluetooth should be included - No scanner option This was purchased as a replacement for Canon's original mobile printer and the improvements were worth it. I do miss the scanner feature I had with my original, but was not enough to keep me from not buying the IP 100.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley Jeltema

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for my husband who needs it for printing reports on the run. The prints are quick, crisp, and clear. The setup was easy and connecting it to our laptop was no problem. We're using a cord to connect both pieces so I can't comment on the wireless feature. All in all a great machine for the price and it fits into such a small space, the laptop, printer and all the cables fit into one briefcase.
customer_reviews.author: RhymeswithTerri

customer_reviews.title: NICE!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite printer!! So good that we have 2!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE!! Compact, good color, great for photos!! Take on the road with you!!
customer_reviews.author: InspireParadise

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little printer
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little printer. Great price. Kills HP portable, (I had HP450 and 460) I print certificates after I teach classes, even heavy stock feeds like butter, it drinks ink, but the inks are so small, its expected. I buy extra inks as soon as I replace an empty so I always have spares in my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Bishop

customer_reviews.title: The only portable inkjet printer that delivers photo-realistic prints. ...
customer_reviews.text: The only portable inkjet printer that delivers photo-realistic prints. Needs to be replaced every 3 years if you travel a lot with it. It is very delicate for a "portable" printer. Just keep it wrapped up when moving it around and it will last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: GEH

customer_reviews.title: highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second iP 100 we've purchased, one for the office, one for home and they are a massive improvement over the iP90. Faster but most importantly, they have substantially larger ink cartridge. The print quality is absolutely tops, both for b & w and for color photo prints. Highly, highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sail-training Expedition Leader and Captain

customer_reviews.title: CANON ip 100 is excellent
customer_reviews.text: this printer prints excellent quality photos. T he onl draw back is the high cost of ink. I have a brother multipurpose printer for da to day and use the p-100 for the few times I need good quality, If it is any thing like the P-90 I junked after 8 year, then you must use it at least once per week to to prevent the main cartridge carrier from drying out.
customer_reviews.author: SIGMUND BLACK

customer_reviews.title: This is a super "quickie" printer
customer_reviews.text: Already own one of these at our vacation house. This is a super "quickie" printer. If you want a high quality print, it will produce that too. It is also very, very quiet in that mode! If you're looking for a small footprint printer, this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Cope

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Returned to my former employer and I only used it once but it worked as a travel printer
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C Anderson II

customer_reviews.title: This made quite good color photo prints
customer_reviews.text: This made quite good color photo prints. However, it really made a racket and took quite a while to finally put out a print. After several months it would not print color - I got nowhere with Canon in solving this. I ended up using it to just print black and white. It completely stopped working a couple of weeks after the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: nice, compact printer
customer_reviews.text: Works really well. I use it with the bluetooth adapter and it is pretty much everything I wanted in a portable printer. I only have two issues which prevent me from giving it 5 stars: first, the paper tray is disappointing, Canon should have put a little tab or something towards the top so the paper in the tray doesn't shift. second, with there was a case to protect it...it is a portable after all.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were so good I've bought 2 of these - both of which broke within two months of using it. It just stops loading paper, or quits altogether. Never again... good thing I bought the extended warranty plan.
customer_reviews.author: Jamieleigh Womach

customer_reviews.title: Quality, ideal size.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for. Does everything a full size desktop printer will do, and I can also take it along on trips in the RV. Does a very good quality print job too. On a negative note, Windows 8.1 keeps telling me it can't communicate both ways with it. But it does do what it is supposed to do....print. Perhaps a driver up-date is in order?
customer_reviews.author: buzzard

customer_reviews.title: The Little Printer that Could
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer as part of my "mobile office" that I take when traveling. Weighs about 4 lbs and is a nice compact size. Although small and light, the printer feels solid, not cheapo. Original purpose was just to print out office documents. It prints out black & white documents very quickly. I was very pleased when it also printed out beautiful photos. Didn't matter if I printed 4x6 blanks or full letter-size: photos looked great. One thing to watch though - you need space for the paper to come out so no interruptions in the paper flow. If the paper hits something when it's coming out of the printer, you might get a line on your photo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an iP90 that I'd used for 8 years with this upgrade, and love it as much as the other. Clean printing, fairly long-lasting cartridges (for their size), and a small footprint. The only reason I knocked off a point is that you have to buy a dongle to have it work wirelessly. I thought EVERYTHING was wireless these days.
customer_reviews.author: D. Archer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer is small enough to travel will with my laptop. I am able to travel with this printer without it adding too much weight to my computer bag. I fly all over the country and I'm able to print no matter where I am and do not need to hope that the hotel has a color printer. I get great printing including photo. They only thing missing is a built in scanner, but maybe I'm asking too much!
customer_reviews.author: Rtackett

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer...
customer_reviews.text: This printer works great for me...I bought the battery and the bluetooth adapter extra, so now I just pull out the printer...open it...insert paper ...turn it on and I am ready to print...no plugging in cord except to charge battery occaisionally. If I know we're going on a trip, I'll make sure the battery is completely charged, then it will be ready to go. Great for RV (space saving) or using in a motel room. Our printer at home is upstairs, so I keep this one downstairs to use for my printing needs, which aren't very often.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: College professor of photography prefers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer for my daughters Christmas. She is a professor of photography at a university and this is the one she wanted to go with her IMAC. This is second one she has of this make. She says it is the best!!
customer_reviews.author: Carole H. Elmore

customer_reviews.title: NOT VERY HAPPY WITH THE PHOTOS, GREAT DETAIL, WASHED-OUT; TEXT IS OK.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to love this. I had wanted to use this in the field, to evaluate photographs in order to paint the scenes I printed. They photos I've printed to date, have been way too washed-out. Which requires multiple printings to correct.
customer_reviews.author: Sane Citizen

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing wrong with the printer, if you ...
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with the printer, if you want a printer that can print documents and pictures then this is a solid printer. I don't travel enough to use the portable aspect that everyone loves. In terms of use I think it is more practical to have a printer with a scanner in todays world. So, solid printer, just wish it had a scanner as I find myself needing one more and more after I bought this printer assuming I didn't need a scanner.
customer_reviews.author: FrozenHobo

customer_reviews.title: It is the best on the market in this size
customer_reviews.text: Very reliable, It is the best on the market in this size. I had an older one that had problems with the first print of the day, this model has solved that. They are a bit fragile I carry it in its original packing when I travel. My old one broke a small part when I carried it in a padded bag.
customer_reviews.author: the pang

customer_reviews.title: Best portable printer, but fragile
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this portable Canon printer - this is my sixth one starting with the BJC-5 in 1992. The problem they all share, however, is that the paper feed system is very fragile. I travel with the printers, and even though I keep it in the original box and packing, perhaps getting knocked around a bit causes the fragile parts in this system to break. I have taken each one I have owned to to the repair center at least once, but there is still no better traveling printer for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: AndyRacer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it a whole lot but when I do it works great. Haven't had any problems or issues, I usually print from my tailgate with no problems. I only print a few pages at a time and so far so good. I love its size and portability. Clean clear copies every time.
customer_reviews.author: joel rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, robust printer for the road
customer_reviews.text: I travel all over the world for work, and need to be able to print at a moment's notice in color. I've hand carried it, checked it in my luggage, dropped it on hotel lobbies, it's fallen out of the back of vans directly onto the pavement, and it keeps on printing like a dream, even after sitting in my closet for weeks to months. I've never had clogged printer heads or any quality issues. It's fast and reliable, pretty darn light, and fits into a carry-on or suitcase easily. It's a good friend on the road and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: janetgalore

customer_reviews.title: Mobile Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I purchased and I love it - It works great on the road and easy to transport with my laptop - I do Taxes for people on the road and need a excellent unit and this is it - great job!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Larry I

customer_reviews.title: This printer goes with me everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: This little printer travels with me everywhere. The printer is easy to use, so fast and convenient. The color printing is crisp and beautiful, very nice. Black and White is clear and it really cranks out the copies. Cannot survive with out this Canon Printer.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey L. Hill

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer!
customer_reviews.text: This printer makes beautiful pictures! I do seem to go through alot of ink but I think that's really just to be expected when the pictures come out so nice. I've been using this printer for probably almost a year now, just for scrapbooking, I would say moderate usage, a few times a month, and so far so good! I'm happy with it and would buy it again. I think for the price it's really good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica B.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need for mobile printing
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these for my field employees. We've been using the Canon mobile printers for 12+ years. I've tried using HP, which are less expensive, but they are bigger and less repairable. They're still more expensive than I'd like (especially when you factor in the large amounts of ink they use), but they're reliable.
customer_reviews.author: CLK

customer_reviews.title: Paper jams and uses MUCH ink.  Print quality good.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for several years. Pros: High quality printing Cons: Paper Jams often. Sometimes every few sheets. Long time to print on the first print request It will use up MUCH ink during calibration at first print and runs out of ink quickly
customer_reviews.author: Boz from Oz

customer_reviews.title: A perfect printer for travel
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect printer to pack for travel- the ink cartridges last for reasonable amount of time. Quality is nice. Not great as a photo printer- does do photos, but not as great as "photo printers". Otherwise, color prints are wonderful. I would get this printer again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Replaced iP100 that lasted 8 years at Wildfires !
customer_reviews.text: A small portable printer with lotza gusto! Just replaced one that performed like a champ for 8 years at wildfire incidents. That says a lot !
customer_reviews.author: artie

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Ok I had the ip 90v so when it started acting up this was my go to printer so far it was the right way to go I like the increased size of the ink cartridge and the increased resolution and even though it says it's bigger than my old printer it is not noticeable at all. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: E. M. collins

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA is not wireless
customer_reviews.text: They claim in the description that it is wireless, it is not. You are required to buy a "bluetooth" adapter for both the printer (it doesn't come with it and for your PC. You cannot print from the internet. 8 hrs and a trip to home depot for a cable later, it does print nicely. It is small and very portable.
customer_reviews.author: California Red

customer_reviews.title: Small And Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Canon iP90. This printer is the same size, faster, and seems to be quieter. Ink cartridges are more cost effective. I have had no problems with paper jams or any other mechanical problems. I am very satisfied with the iP100's performance. Highly recommend for a small footprint portable printer.
customer_reviews.author: Roy McClure

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a must have if you travel ~ easy set up ~ easy to use ~ reliable and amazing color photos! Ink cartridges are easy to replace and the cartridges last a long time! Light weight makes it easy to bring along ~ consider getting a retractable USB cord for your on the go set-up. I loved this printer so much that when my office printer needed to be replaced a purchase another Canon Pixma so now I have one for out of the country business trips and one for my office.
customer_reviews.author: LG

customer_reviews.title: quit working
customer_reviews.text: Started making noise after printing 20 or so 4 by 6 pictures . It sounds like it has striped some gears . It would do nothing but make noise . Only reason for two stars is Amazon's great return policy . I returned it and they are sending me a replacement free of charge .
customer_reviews.author: William McCay

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I love the iP100 printer. It is very compact and lightweight and reliable. And I find I can depend on Canon printers to work well, plus their tech support (as well as their in-person) service is really great. I own 2 of them and am very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: new printer received in excellent condition
customer_reviews.text: I have used this printer for three years, the TSA lost mine and I replaced it with this new one. It is small enough for my computer job, does a good job printing, is fairly good on ink usage. I am please with it. The seller came through right on time, packaged well, all in all very happy with the order
customer_reviews.author: H J. Steinacher

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must have!
customer_reviews.text: This little, compact printer really gets the job done! It's easy and efficient, just open it up and plug it in. We travel a lot and it fit perfect in my computer suitcase along with the rest of my rolling office. So glad we made the purchase it really made our life easier!!
customer_reviews.author: Kymnbob

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: I've printed hundred of pages, haven't had a single issue. It small and compact so I am able to fit it in my laptop bag. You can get a battery for it and blue tooth adapter as well (I have both) and that makes it completely wire free and portable. A bit pricey but the quality is there!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Very nice printer, feels solid and very light. I do not print a lot of photos, but I do travel frequently and this printer works great. Very easy to setup, Windows 7 installed all the drivers without using the cd that came with it. I use this in conjunction with a sony Vaio notebook, and got the $20 Zoom bluetooth adapter to print wirelessly and works flawlessly. I highly recommend this printer for travel or home use, very powerful for a small design.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! Pixma portable printer
customer_reviews.text: It's small, light weight, fast printing and fit's into my carryon luggage. Airports have not even questioned us about it. We are traveling (flying and driving) a lot and needed the use of a printer on demand. One problem: my husband is having a bit of a problem finding the right driver to download for his MacBook Pro. I had to find a newer site for my MACBOOK AIR driver, but it is working now. Since I am the one using the printer most of the time, it meets our needs for a workable portable printer, ideal for traveling. Kathleen Pelton
customer_reviews.author: MochaMama

customer_reviews.title: I like the portability
customer_reviews.text: It's not the fastest printer in the world for sure, but it's portable and does a good job of printing. The ink cartridges don't last a long time, but I just use the generic cartridges because Canon's are pretty expensive. But I'm happy with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Just Me

customer_reviews.title: A Marvelous Invention
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a light-weight powerful printer, and I got it. The quality of the pictures are extremely good. I mainly use it to print worksheets for my 5 year old. The vibrancy of the colours are exactly what I needed to help stimulate her interest not only in colour but also in the objects on the worksheets. Highly reccommended. Kudos to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Che-Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for travel and it really does a nice job. Compact. Only complaint is it uses ink like there's no tomorrow. Canon makes great products. I have a work station in my office. This one you will really like
customer_reviews.author: A CUT ABOVE

customer_reviews.title: Canon iP 100 Mobile Printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed a 12volt printer that I could use to print photos while I am traveling in my RV. After searching the web, I settled on the Canon iP100 - I had to get the (overly expensive) 12volt power cord directly from Canon because Amazon was out of them. I am very happy with the quality of the photos. Any printer will print B&W text pages but a moblile printer that will output quality photos is tough to find. Too bad that Canon makes it so difficult to buy their photo paper - but that's different story. HP, Epson and Moab photo papers all work fine. One suggestion: download Canon's updated driver immediately after installing this printer for best results.
customer_reviews.author: baydogs

customer_reviews.title: Same results as a full-sized printer, but much, much smaller!
customer_reviews.text: I got the Canon IP100 a few weeks ago, and I absolutely love it! I use it literally every day to print out stuff I need for work the next day on 65 lbs cardstock, and the results are perfect. My dorm room came with a tiny computer desk with a little shelf over the monitor area that has room for my speakers and not much else, and the printer fits perfectly on that shelf with room to spare. It really is tiny, but has the exact same results as a full-size printer! Highly recommended! The only way it could be better is if it had a scanner function too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Surdhar

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer; better if worked with AirPrint
customer_reviews.text: Nice printer and solves my issue of needed to print documents on the fly. It'd be perfect if it was comparable with Apple's AirPrint so I could use my iPad and the optional Blue Tooth. Now I have to utilize a Windows-based notebook, but still handy.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: More than impressed
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me streamline my business. Now I can print out forms and literature on the go for my clients. They are impressed by it as well. I've only had it snag two pieces of paper once and I had way too much paper in the feeder.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Mink

customer_reviews.title: not as small and light as wish - paper jams
customer_reviews.text: larger and heavier than first impressions get to be a pain to lug around so not quite as portable as I would have liked, performance reasonable but not great in terms of speed, paper handling a bit prone to jamming
customer_reviews.author: Michael Daniec

customer_reviews.title: Makes A Good First Impression To Me
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my business which requires me to be able to print from anywhere. So far, my impression is very positive. I have this connected via bluetooth using a Rocketek Low Energy USB bluetooth 4.0 adapter (model RT-BT4) to a Google Nexus 7. With the PrinterShare app using the iP5000 drivers, it works perfectly. Also, my PC had no problem finding it and printing via bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gong

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Canon Pixma IP100. I lost my first one while transiting through an airport. The IP100 Canon printer continues to show good reliability and durability during my field trip. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jtel87

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA iP100 Mobile Photo Printer (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Today's mobile professional has more pressure than ever to be able to conduct business almost anywhere. The rugged, compact iP100 Mobile Printer delivers remarkable quality and print-anywhere portability. It affords users the ability to print beautiful borderless color photos from the car or even at the beach. Its patented print head technology and 5-color ink system let you create spectacular photos with 9600 x 2400 color dpi resolution (max.) A photo lab quality 4-inch x 6-inch borderless print takes only about 50 seconds. It offers IrDA compatibility and an optional BU-30 Bluetooth interface, so you can print wirelessly from a PC, PDA or camera phone. Or, connect a digital camera and print photos direct-no PC required. An optional Canon car adapter and rechargeable battery kit provide power on the go. Plus, the Auto Image Fix feature corrects images for the best possible exposure, color, brightness and contrast. This printer has increased color resolution with faster printing speeds than previous models, while offering a number of accessories that make it easier to conduct business outside of the office. The lightweight Canon PIXMA iP100 Mobile Printer fits easily onto a desk with limited space or into a carry-on, making it the perfect laptop companion for business or personal travel.OS Compatibility: Windows 7, Windows Vista, Windows XP/2000 and Mac OS X v.10.3.9 to 10.5.x7.Paper Sizes Credit Card (2.13" x 3.39"), 4" x 6," 4" x 8," 5" x 7," 8" x 10," Letter, Legal, U.S. #10 Envelopes, Photo Stickers.

AMAZON.COM
Amazon.com Product DescriptionCanon's stylish iP100 Mobile Printer travels with you, delivering outstanding photo print quality wherever you are. Thanks to a blazing sprint speed, you can have a beautiful 4 x 6 inch print in less than a minute. The iP100 is perfect for traveling photographers, vacationers making their own post cards, businessmen who need to make the perfect color presentation on the road, and anyone else who wants a high-quality print anywhere. 

 

Outstanding Prints from a Tiny Device
At a compact 12.7 x 2.4 x 7.2 inches (WxHxD) and weighing in at a scant 4.4 pounds, the iP100 is a rugged, attractive device that is easy to slip into your briefcase or traveling bag. You can further increase the portability by adding the optional car adapter or battery kit.  Don't mistake compact for low-quality. The iP100 produces spectacular photos at 9600 x 2400 dpi. Canon's patented print head with 1,856 precision nozzles ejects ink at droplets as small as 1 picoliter for incredible photo realism and accuracy. Together with the 5-color ink system, you are ensured the highest quality output. All without a long waiting: a photo lab-quality 4 x 6 inch borderless print takes about 55 seconds. For printing documents, the iP100 can print black-and-white documents at up to 20 ppm and color documents at up to 14 ppm. 

 Print from Macs and PCs and Directly from Cameras The Canon PIXMA iP100 is compatible with Windows Vista/XP/2000 and Mac OS X v 10.2.8 to 10.5.x, connecting via a USB interface. Additionally, it also has a built-in IrDA interface and an optional Bluetooth interface, letting you print wirelessly from a PC, PDA or camera phone. The printer also supports the PictBridge interface for connecting compatible digital cameras and printing photos directly -- without a PC. 

 

There is no need to worry that you weren't first able to touch up a photo when printing directly from the camera; Canon's Auto Image Fix lets you automatically correct for exposure, color, brightness, and contrast.  The Canon PIXMA iP100 photo printer is backed by toll-free technical support and a 1-year limited warranty with InstantExchange program. 

 What's in the Box
iP100 mobile printer, document kit (quick start guide, leopard information sheet, easy setup instructions, setup software & user's guide CD-ROM, user guide), ink cartridges (one black, one color), AC adapter, power cord, print head, bundled media MP-101, sample media PP-201.
feature_bullets: Compatible with CLI-36 Ink Tanks & PGI-35 Pigment Black Ink Tanks. Save Even More On Combo/Value Packs!
Compact photo printer offers lab-quality prints with take-anywhere portability. Measures a compact 12.7 x 2.4 x 7.2 inches (WxHxD)
Patented print head uses 1,856 nozzles for outstanding print quality at 9600 x 2400 dpi
Support for IrDA and PictBridge lets you print directly from cameras and cell phones

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars696 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
